nodes.bodyText:
nits: no need of 's' in middle words (messages, transactions).
orderFilterValues → 'orderBy' (order is not filter)
topicMessagesFormatFilterValues → topicMessageFormat (response format is not a filter)
transactionResultFilterValues → transactionResultFilter
transactionsTypeFilterValues → cryptoTransferType (transactionType has different connotation in rest of our stack)
orderFilterValues looks unchanged. np, can be done later.
function is not being used anywhere.
Yeah left over from the split.
Please also change other 'asc'/'desc' strings in this file to use constants.orderFilterValues too.
/topic/:id/message. Also update tests with the same.

I disagree on this one. We're dealing with a collection here so the plural name makes sense and is consistent with the rest of the API.
I definitely subscribe to the standard of REST API endpoints should be plural unless the entity is singular in nature

Had a group discussion on this.
Will open a ticket to address inconsistencies of singular vs plural on the topic endpoints.
Plan here is to leave as is as next spring the likelihood is to make everything plural
